page.title: 13 - FARMING
page.content: Farming in the area is mainly mixed. There are water meadows near the river Rother, liable to flooding, and used only for rough grazing. The higher land supports cereals, potatoes, oilseed rape and maize. Several smaller fields have been made into larger ones so that the farmer can fully utilise the modern machinery, thus saving time and manpower. Common Market support policies are making it more profitable to grow cereal crops than to produce milk and beef. Despite this, there are still two or three large dairy herds in the area. Pigs and sheep are present in the area but not in large commercial numbers. There is a small market garden at Burton Common.
